While similar to {@code BasicImageReader}, this class is not a conceptual + * subtype of, it and deliberately hides types such as {@code ImageLocation} to + * give a focused API based only on nodes. + * @@ -127,1 +129,1 @@ - * Finds the node for the given JRT file system name. + * Finds the node with the given name. @@ -129,2 +131,2 @@ - * @param name a JRT file system name (path) of the form - * {@code "/modules//...} or {@code "/packages//...}. + * @param name a node name of the form {@code "/modules//...} or + * {@code "/packages//...}. @@ -271,2 +273,2 @@ - /// Returns a node in the JRT filesystem namespace, or null if no resource or - /// directory of that name exists. + /// Returns a node with the given name, or null if no resource or directory of + /// that name exists. @@ -386,2 +388,1 @@ - // Add the "/modules" prefix to image location paths to get - // Jrt file system names. + // Add "/modules" prefix to image location paths to get node names. @@ -454,1 +455,1 @@ - /// namespace (if so, the location name is the Jrt filesystem name). + /// namespace (if so, the location name is the node name). @@ -463,1 +464,1 @@ - /// namespace (if so, the location name is the Jrt filesystem name). + /// namespace (if so, the location name is the node name). @@ -510,1 +511,1 @@ - * A directory, resource or symbolic link in the JRT file system namespace. + * A directory, resource or symbolic link. @@ -550,2 +551,2 @@ - * Returns the JRT file system compatible name of this node (e.g. - * {@code "/modules/java.base/java/lang/Object.class"} or {@code + * Returns the name of this node (e.g. {@code + * "/modules/java.base/java/lang/Object.class"} or {@code @@ -553,0 +554,3 @@ + * + *
